page.title: 10Attitudes of Shenstone
page.content: The attitudes of Shenstones population is varied but cannot be changed. We have asked 12 school children of different age groups some questions about Shenstone and things around us. The majority of people did not want development there. Obviously farmers don't want development as it would endanger their land. The majority of people use T.V more than Radio but find both enjoyable. Most people would like a toy shop or a games arcade in Shenstone. All together most people like the school but do not like the idea of a secondry one. Also most people think the old people need more help, but some are jealous and say they get too much attention. Most people like Shenstone because it is a country village and it has hardly any industrial scars. R.LANGLEY & C.SCEATS
